name: Structured Data Capture Questionnaire Design
publisher: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)
description: Defines how form is used to reflect form definitions to be used within the ONC's Structured Data Capture standard.

definition.formal: A structured set of questions intended to guide the collection of answers. The questions are ordered and grouped into coherent subsets, corresponding to the structure of the grouping of the underlying questions.

constraint.name: UniqueLinkIds
constraint.human: The link ids for groups and questions must be unique within the questionnaire

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
definition.comments: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

definition.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
definition.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

definition.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
definition.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
definition.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

definition.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
definition.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

definition.formal: This records identifiers associated with this question set that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

definition.short: Logical id for this version of Questionnaire
definition.formal: The version number assigned by the publisher for business reasons.  It may remain the same when the resource is updated.
The lifecycle status of the questionnaire as a whole.

mapping.map: .statusCode (also whether there's a revisionControlAct - and possibly mood to distinguish "in progress" from "published)

definition.short: Identifies when this version of the form was created.  Changes whenever the form is updated.
definition.formal: Identifies when this version of the form was created.  Changes whenever the form is updated.
Organization responsible for developing and maintaining the questionnaire.
A collection of related questions (or further groupings of questions).
definition.comments: The Questionnaire itself has one "root" group with the actual contents of the Questionnaire.  Inquestionnaireation on this root group applies to the questionnaire as a whole.

constraint.name: GroupHaveSubOrQuestions
constraint.human: Groups may either contain questions or groups but not both

definition.short: To link questionnaire with questionnaire answers
definition.formal: A unique identifier within the questionnaire allowing linkage to the equivalent group in a QuestionnaireAnswers resource.
definition.comments: May be omitted if there is no expectation to link answers back to a questionnaire.

definition.short: Name to be displayed for group
definition.formal: The human-readable name for this section of the questionnaire.
definition.comments: The title of the "root" group is the title for the questionnaire.

definition.short: Concept that represents this section on a questionnaire
definition.formal: Identifies a how this group of questions is known in a particular terminology such as LOINC.
definition.comments: The code(s) for the "root" group apply to the questionnaire as a whole.

binding.name: QuestionnaireGroupConcept
binding.description: Codes for questionnaires and groupings of questionnaire questions

definition.formal: Additional text for the group, used for display purposes.

definition.short: Must group be included in data results?
definition.formal: If true, indicates that the group must be present and have required questions within it answered.  If false, the group may be skipped when answering the questionnaire.
Whether the group may occur multiple times in the instance, containing multiple sets of answers.
definition.comments: When repeats is not given, false is assumed.

definition.formal: A sub-group within a group. The ordering of groups within this group is relevant.
Set of questions within this group. The order of questions within the group is relevant.

definition.short: To link questionnaire with questionnaire answers
definition.formal: A unique identifiers within the questionnaire allowing linkage to the equivalent group in a QuestionnaireData resource.
definition.comments: May be omitted if there is no expectation to link answers back to a questionnaire.

definition.short: Concept that represents this section on a questionnaire
definition.formal: Identifies a how this group of questions is known in a particular terminology such as LOINC.

definition.short: Text of the question as it is shown to the user
definition.formal: Text of the question as it is shown to the user.
The expected format of the answer, e.g. the type of input (string, integer) or whether a (multiple)choice is expected.
definition.comments: Time is handled using "string".  File is handled using Attachment.  (content can be sent as a contained binary).

binding.name: AnswerFormat
binding.description: The expected format of an answer

mapping.map: N/A - MIF rather than RIM level

definition.short: Must group be included in data results?
definition.formal: If true, indicates that the group must be present and have required questions within it answered.  If false, the group may be skipped when answering the questionnaire.
Whether the group may occur multiple times in the instance, containing multiple sets of answers.
definition.comments: When repeats is not given, false is assumed.

definition.formal: Reference to a valueset containing the possible options.

mapping.map: Not supported - MIF/templating layer to capture value set

definition.formal: Nested group, containing nested question for this question. The order of groups within the question is relevant.

definition.short: Identifies when this version of the form was created.  Changes whenever the form is updated.
definition.formal: Identifies when this version of the form was created.  Changes whenever the form is updated.

definition.comments: Are there form rendering mechanisms where it would be unreasonable to require systems to support this extension?.
Time is handled using "string".  File is handled using Attachment.  (content can be sent as a contained binary).

definition.formal: Provides rules governing the use of this questionnaire from a privacy and/or security perspective.  E.g. "confidential when completed".
definition.comments: Omission of this extensions doesn't indicate a lack of security or privacy considerations.  They may be reflected in the description or might be implicit in context or workflow.

definition.formal: The base URL for the server to which questionnaire answers associated with this questionnaire should be submitted.
definition.comments: Indicates that the form has been designed with an expectation that it will be submitted to the specified URI.  If multiple endpoints are specified, expectation is that answers are submitted to all endpoints.

definition.formal: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.
definition.comments: When omitted, sections are presumed to be "regular" sections.

binding.name: QuestionnaireGroupSpecialType
binding.description: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.

extensionDefn.display: Extra text to display for group

definition.short: Extra text to display for group
definition.formal: Additional text to display at the group level along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.
The additional text to display.
Categorizes the type of additional group text.  E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", etc.
definition.comments: The type of text may provide guidance for how/when to display the information.

binding.name: QuestionnaireGroupTextType
binding.description: Categorizes the type of additional group text.  E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", etc.

extensionDefn.display: Extra text to display for question

definition.short: Extra text to display for question
definition.formal: Additional text to display for the question along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.
The additional text to display.
Categorizes the type of additional group text.  E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", "Units" etc.
definition.comments: The type of text may provide guidance for how/when to display the information.

binding.name: QuestionnaireQuestionTextType
binding.description: Categorizes the type of additional group text.  E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", "Units" etc.
